candidates.title: fix: improve paramcache
candidates.body:
When no sizes are given as input, you get a multiselect dialog on
the terminal.

Also the parameter generation now has a spinning indicator while
parameters are generated.

candidates.title: feat: integrate fixes to bellman and neptune
candidates.body:
needs 
- https://github.com/filecoin-project/phase2/pull/5 
- bellperson@0.8.0
- neptune@0.7.1

candidates.title: fix: use single replica file when using sub-trees
feat: update dependencies
feat(filecoin-proofs): improve parampublish
candidates.body:
This PR fixes parts of https://github.com/filecoin-project/rust-fil-proofs/issues/1079.

I originally misunderstood some of the requirements, hence it got fancier then probably anticipated. You can now select the sizes you want to publish, with having the defaults pre-selected.

This PR can also be reviewed commit per commit, I tried to make them self-contained (the commit message should explain some of the reasons for some of the changes).

@DrPeterVanNostrand I've added you for review as I updated dialoguer, which also needed a little change in the phase2 bin code. I just want to make sure you are aware of that change, in case something breaks (which I won't expect).

This PR supersedes #1090.

candidates.title: no more match
candidates.body: needs https://github.com/filecoin-project/neptune/pull/16

candidates.title: feat(storage-proofs): integrate neptune's column tree builder
fix: updates to merkle_light tree leafs interface
candidates.body: Minor updates for potential interface change.

candidates.title: refactor: split storage-proof into subcrates
candidates.body:
This helps compile times and makes dev cycles quicker.

There are now
- storage-proofs-core - everything shared
- storage-proofs-porep - all poreps
- storage-proofs-post - all posts
- storage-proofs - same api as before, reexports the others

candidates.title: Compound MerkleTrees
candidates.body:
- Integrate Compound Merkle Trees throughout
- Setup improved abstractions `MerkleTreeTrait` and `MerkleProofTrait`
- Remove election post from the public api

candidates.title: fix: update bitvec to 0.17
candidates.body: The old versions were yanked due to a unsafety issue

candidates.title: feat: update merkle tree usage and add merkleproofs bench

candidates.body: Also improves testing

candidates.body: feat: allow merkleproof bench to use supported tree arities

candidates.title: feat: directly build tree_r stores as cached trees
candidates.body: fix: upgrade failure dep and remove workaround

candidates.title: fix: lock 'quote' dependency to fix failure-derive
candidates.body:
More information:
https://users.rust-lang.org/t/failure-derive-compilation-error/39062

candidates.title: chore: update dependencies
fix: properly set cache levels on tree configs
candidates.body: fix: move tree size/arity checks to simplify

candidates.title: fix: update failed bench tests
feat(storage-proofs): speed up create_label
candidates.body:
- Improves perf of create_label by about 10-15% when used with sha intrinsics. 
- Introduces a new crate `sha2raw` which is optimized for this use case.
- Cleanup and unify `create_label` calls.
- Set core affinity during label generation.

candidates.title: feat: oct trees with new neptune
feat: add md hash and implement for Poseidon
candidates.body:
Add just enough support for Merkle-Damgard construction to use with Poseidon.

- Add `hash_md` and `hash_md_circuit` methods to `HashFunction` trait.
- Default `hash_md` implementation in terms of `hash2` (untested).
- No default implementation for `hash_md_circuit`.
- Implement both for `PoseidonDomain`.
- Use arity 36 by default.
- NOTE: Arity is a program-wide constant, 'PoseidonMDArity`.

candidates.title: feat: integrate external data reader for tree r
feat: switch to quad trees in stacked
feat: switch to fff
candidates.body: Forked version of ff, as well as latest versions of all snark deps

candidates.title: feat: switch to poseidon by default
candidates.body:
This switches 
- column hashes and
- merkle trees

to use Poseidon

Outstanding are 
- switch to poseidon for the partial ticket (election post)
which will be done at a later point

candidates.title: feat: improved approach to do bit padding/calculate piece commitments
Run PoSt proofs with high priority
candidates.body:
This is using the priority locking from https://github.com/filecoin-project/bellman/pull/58.

I've split it into two commits, the second commit isn't strictly needed but useful for testing, so that you can run the PoSt also with low priority.

candidates.title: feat: switch to SDR
fix: uom 0.26 needs at least heim 0.0.9
candidates.body:
Without using heim version 0.0.9 explicitly, version 0.0.7 will be used implicitly,
which results in a broken build.

The error message prior to this fix is:

```
   Compiling fil-proofs-tooling v0.6.1 (/tmp/rust-fil-proofs/fil-proofs-tooling)
error[E0277]: the trait bound `uom::si::information::byte: uom::si::information::Unit` is not satisfied
   --> fil-proofs-tooling/src/metadata.rs:110:48
    |
110 |             memory_total_bytes: memory.total().get::<uom::si::information::byte>(),
    |                                                ^^^ the trait `uom::si::information::Unit` is not implemented for `uom::si::information::byte`

error[E0277]: the trait bound `uom::si::information::byte: uom::Conversion<u64>` is not satisfied
   --> fil-proofs-tooling/src/metadata.rs:110:48
    |
110 |             memory_total_bytes: memory.total().get::<uom::si::information::byte>(),
    |                                                ^^^ the trait `uom::Conversion<u64>` is not implemented for `uom::si::information::byte`

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: could not compile `fil-proofs-tooling`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
```

candidates.title: fix: pin ff to 0.5.0
feat: add fain-grained benchmark capabilities
candidates.body:
The new option is called "flarp". Run it like this:

```console
> echo '{
      "drg_parents": 6,
      "expander_parents": 8,
      "graph_parents": 8,
      "porep_challenges": 50,
      "porep_partitions": 10,
      "post_challenged_nodes": 1,
      "post_challenges": 20,
      "sector_size_bytes": 1024,
      "stacked_layers": 4,
      "window_size_bytes": 512,
      "wrapper_parents_all": 8
  }' > config.json
> cat config.json|RUST_BACKTRACE=1 RUST_LOG=info cargo run --release --package fil-proofs-tooling --bin=benchy -- flarp
…
{
  "git": {
    "hash": "8d20594bcb637aacbe4a8cde420be37dc223d6f0",
    "date": "2019-12-18T20:30:10Z"
  },
  "system": {
    "system": "Linux",
    "release": "5.2.0-3-amd64",
    "version": "#1 SMP Debian 5.2.17-1 (2019-09-26)",
    "architecture": "x86_64",
    "processor": "Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-8550U CPU @ 1.80GHz",
    "processor-base-frequency-hz": 2000,
    "processor-max-frequency-hz": 4000,
    "processor-features": "FeatureInfo { eax: 526058, ebx: 34605056, edx_ecx: SSE3 | PCLMULQDQ | DTES64 | MONITOR | DSCPL | VMX | EIST | TM2 | SSSE3 | FMA | CMPXCHG16B | PDCM | PCID | SSE41 | SSE42 | X2APIC | MOVBE | POPCNT | TSC_DEADLINE | AESNI | XSAVE | OSXSAVE | AVX | F16C | RDRAND | FPU | VME | DE | PSE | TSC | MSR | PAE | MCE | CX8 | APIC | SEP | MTRR | PGE | MCA | CMOV | PAT | PSE36 | CLFSH | DS | ACPI | MMX | FXSR | SSE | SSE2 | SS | HTT | TM | PBE | 0x4800 }",
    "processor-cores-logical": 8,
    "processor-cores-physical": 4,
    "memory-total-bytes": 32932844000
  },
  "benchmarks": {
    "inputs": {
      "window_size_bytes": 512,
      "sector_size_bytes": 1024,
      "drg_parents": 6,
      "expander_parents": 8,
      "porep_challenges": 50,
      "porep_partitions": 10,
      "post_challenges": 20,
      "post_challenged_nodes": 1,
      "stacked_layers": 4,
      "wrapper_parents_all": 8
    },
    "outputs": {
      "comm_d_cpu_time_ms": 0,
      "comm_d_wall_time_ms": 0,
      "encode_window_time_all_cpu_time_ms": 10,
      "encode_window_time_all_wall_time_ms": 3,
      "encoding_cpu_time_ms": 31,
      "encoding_wall_time_ms": 19,
      "epost_cpu_time_ms": 1,
      "epost_wall_time_ms": 1,
      "generate_tree_c_cpu_time_ms": 9,
      "generate_tree_c_wall_time_ms": 5,
      "porep_commit_time_cpu_time_ms": 70,
      "porep_commit_time_wall_time_ms": 24,
      "porep_proof_gen_cpu_time_ms": 6482015,
      "porep_proof_gen_wall_time_ms": 966450,
      "post_finalize_ticket_cpu_time_ms": 0,
      "post_finalize_ticket_time_ms": 0,
      "epost_inclusions_cpu_time_ms": 2,
      "epost_inclusions_wall_time_ms": 0,
      "post_partial_ticket_hash_cpu_time_ms": 1,
      "post_partial_ticket_hash_time_ms": 1,
      "post_proof_gen_cpu_time_ms": 60619,
      "post_proof_gen_wall_time_ms": 9533,
      "post_read_challenged_range_cpu_time_ms": 0,
      "post_read_challenged_range_time_ms": 0,
      "post_verify_cpu_time_ms": 32,
      "post_verify_wall_time_ms": 29,
      "tree_r_last_cpu_time_ms": 14,
```

This is https://github.com/filecoin-project/rust-fil-proofs/pull/983 squashed into a single commit and rebased.

candidates.title: fix: reduce add piece memory
candidates.body:
Blocked by [this upstream merkle PR](https://github.com/filecoin-project/merkle_light/pull/60).

## What's in this PR?

- stop using in memory merkle tree for generating piece commitments
- stop caching the whole data for a piece commitment in memory
